scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Four letters, 1851-1856, from Clay to Edmund Quincy concerning personal affairs, politics, and problems encountered by Clay for publicly stating his anti-slavery views; and a letter, 1875, to W. Scott Smith asking his support for the vice-presidential nomination of the Democratic Party.
